revisions.rev: {{unreferenced|date=December 2008}} {{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=2008 |Team=Boston College Eagles |Image= |ImageSize= |Conference=Atlantic Coast Conference |ShortConference=ACC |Division=Atlantic |CoachRank= |APRank= |BCSRank= |Record=9-5 |ConfRecord=5-3 |HeadCoach=[[Jeff Jagodzinski]] |OffCoach=[[Steve Logan (football)|Steve Logan]] |DefCoach=[[Frank Spaziani]] |OScheme= |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Alumni Stadium]] (44,500) |Champion=ACC Atlantic Division Co-Champions |BowlTourney=[[2008 Music City Bowl|Music City Bowl]] vs. [[2008 Vanderbilt Commodores football team|Vanderbilt]] |BowlTourneyResult= L 14â16 |ConfChamp=[[2008 ACC Championship Game|ACC Championship Game]] |ConfChampResult= L, v. [[2008 Virginia Tech Hokies football team|Virginia Tech]] }} {{2008 ACC football standings}} The '''2008 [[Boston College Eagles football]] team''' represented [[Boston College]] during the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]] (NCAA) [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] [[Division I (NCAA)#Football Bowl Subdivision|Football Bowl Subdivision]] (FBS) college football [[2008 NCAA Division I FBS football season|season]]. It was Boston College's [[2008 Atlantic Coast Conference football season|fourth season]] as a member of the [[Atlantic Coast Conference]] (ACC). The Eagles were led by [[Jeff Jagodzinski]] in his second and final season as Boston College head coach. Boston College has been a member of the [[Atlantic Coast Conference]]'s (ACC) Atlantic Division since joining the league in [[2005 NCAA Division I-A football season|2005]], after leaving the [[Big East Conference]]. The Eagles played their home games in 2008 at [[Alumni Stadium]] in [[Chestnut Hill, Massachusetts|Chestnut Hill]], [[Massachusetts]], which has been their "home" stadium since [[1957 college football season|1957]]. ==Season recap== Boston College had to replace [[Matt Ryan (American football)|Matt Ryan]], who was drafted 3rd overall in the [[2008 NFL Draft]] by the [[Atlanta Falcons]]. Senior quarterback [[Chris Crane]] was the starter at the beginning of the year to take over the starting quarterback position. In the November 22 game against [[Wake Forest University|Wake Forest]], Crane broke his collar bone, and was replaced with Dominique Davis. Other big losses that had to be dealt with from the 2007 season include tailback L.V. Witworth and running back Andre Callender. True [[freshman]] Josh Haden was assumed to be the starting [[running back]], but true freshman [[Montel Harris]] later turned out to have the starting job. BC finished the year with one the best defenses in College Football, with the most Interceptions in all of FBS Football, and allowing the 5th least amount of yards. The Team had its first loss in a home game against [[2008 Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets football team|Georgia Tech]]. It went on to lose two more games against the [[2008 North Carolina Tar Heels football team|North Carolina]] and the [[2008 Clemson Tigers football team|Clemson]] before winning four games in a row to take the team to its second [[2008 ACC Championship Game|ACC Championship Game]] in a row, which again, put the Eagles against the [[2008 Virginia Tech Hokies football team|Virginia Tech Hokies]]. The Eagles lost the game 12â30, and placed the team in the [[Gaylord Hotels Music City Bowl]] in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. The Eagles lost the game to [[2008 Vanderbilt Commodores football team|Vanderbilt]], which not only ended the Eagles bowl winning streak, which was the longest in the nation, but gave Vanderbilt its first bowl win in over 50 years. On January 5, 2008, Coach Jagodzinski was fired by Boston College, for apparently interviewing for the head coaching vacancy for the [[National Football League|NFL]] [[New York Jets]] despite being warned not to. He was later hired as the offensive coordinator for the [[Tampa Bay Buccaneers]]. ==Schedule== {{CFB Schedule Start|time=|rank=|ranklink=|rankyear=2008|tv=|attend=yes}} {{CFB Schedule Entry | date =
